gurmukhi: ੴ> ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ||
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਮੰਗਲਾਚਰਣ- ਸਤਿਗੁਰ
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਸੳੁਦਾ ੲਿਕਤੁ ਹਟਿ ਹੈ ਪੀਰਾਂ ਪੀਰੁ ਗੁਰਾਂ ਗੁਰੁ ਪੂਰਾ
transliteration: Saudaa Ikatu Hati Hai Peeraan Peeru Guraan Guru Pooraa.
translation: Merchandise (of truth) is available only at that centre wherein sits the pit of the pits and the perfect Guru of the gurus.

gurmukhi: ਪਤਿਤ ੳੁਧਾਰਣੁ ਦੁਖ ਹਰਣੁ ਅਸਰਣੁ ਸਰਣਿ ਵਚਨ ਦਾ ਸੂਰਾ
transliteration: Patit Udhaaranu Doukh Haranu Asaranu Sarani Vachan Daa Sooraa.
translation: He is saviour of the fallen, dispeller of sufferings, and shelter of the shelterless.

gurmukhi: ਅੳੁਗੁਣ ਲੈ ਗੁਣ ਵਿਕਣੈ ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰੁ ਵਿਸਰਾੲਿ ਵਿਸੂਰਾ
transliteration: Aougan Lai Goun Vikanai Soukh Saagaru Visaraai Visooraa.
translation: He takes away our demerits and bestows virtues.

gurmukhi: ਕੋਟ ਵਿਕਾਰ ਹਜਾਰ ਲਖ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ਸਦਾ ਹਜੂਰਾ
transliteration: Kati Vikaar Hajaar Lakh Paraoupakaaree Sadaa Hajooraa.
translation: Instead, ocean of delights, the Lord makes us forget grief and disappointment.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਨਾਮੁ ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਸਤਿ ਸਰੂਪੁ ਨ ਕਦਹੀ ੳੂਰਾ
transliteration: Satinaamu Karataa Purakhu Sati Saroopu N Kadahee Ooraa.
translation: He, the decimater of lacs of evils, is benevolent and ever present. He whose name is Truth, creator Lord, the truth form, never becomes incomplete i.e. He is ever complete.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚਖੰਡ ਵਸਿ ਅਨਹਦ ਸਬਦ ਵਜਾੲੇ ਤੂਰਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Sach Khand Vasi Anahad Sabad Vajaaay Tooraa.
translation: Residing in the holy congregation, the abode of truth,

gurmukhi: ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਕਰੇ ਚਕਚੂਰਾ ||੧||
transliteration: Doojaa Bhaau Karay Chakachooraa ?1?
translation: He blows the trumpet of unstruck melody and shatters the sense of duality.

gurmukhi: ੨ ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਤ
translation: Holy congregation

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਜਾਤ ਨ ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤੁ ਵੀਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Paaras Paraoupakaar Kari Jaat N Asat Dhaatu Veechaarai.
translation: The philosopher's stone when showering benevolence (of making gold)

gurmukhi: ਬਾਵਨ ਚੰਦਨ ਬੋਹਿਂਦਾ ਅਫਲ ਸਫਲ ਨ ਜੁਗਤਿ ੳੁਰ ਧਾਰੇ
transliteration: Baavan Chandan Bohidaa Aphal Saphalu N Jougati Ur Dhaarai.
translation: Does not take into consideration the kind, and caste of the eight metals (alloy).

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਤੇ ੲਿੰਦਰ ਵਰਸਦਾ ਥਾੳੁਂ ਕੁਥਾੳੁਂ ਨ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਧਾਰੇ
transliteration: Sabh Tay Indar Varasadaa Daaoun Kudaaoun N Anmrit Dhaarai.
translation: Sandal makes all trees fragrant and their fruitlessness and fruitfulness never occurs to its mind.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਜੋਤਿ ੳੁਦੋਤ ਕਰਿ ਓਤ ਪੋਤਿ ਹੋ ਕਿਰਣ ਪਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Sooraj Joti Udot Kari Aotapoti Ho Kiran Pasaarai.
translation: The sun rises and spreads its rays equally at all the places.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਹਨ ਸੀਲ ਪਰਮਲ ਹਰੈ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਨ ਚਿਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Dharatee Andari Sahan Seel Par Mal Harai Avagoun N Chitaarai.
translation: Tolerance is the virtue of earth which accepts the refuse of others and never beholds their demerits.

gurmukhi: ਲਾਲ ਜਵਾਹਰ ਮਣਿ ਲੋਹਾ ਸੁੲਿਨਾ ਪਾਰਸ ਜਾਤਿ ਬਿਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Laal Javaahar Mani Lohaa Suinaa Paaras Jaati Bichaarai.
translation: Similarly, jewels, rubies, pearls, iron, philosopher's stone, gold etc. preserve their innate nature.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਕਾ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਪਾਰੇ ||੨||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Kaa Antu N Paarai ?2?
translation: No limits are there of (the benevolence of) the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ੩ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ- ਸਭ ਫਲਦਾਤੀ
translation: Service to the true Guru provides all fruits -

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸ ਧਾਤਿ ਕੰਚਨ ਕਰੈ ਹੋੲਿ ਮਨੂਰ ਨ ਕੰਚਨ ਝੂਰੈ
transliteration: Paaras Dhaati Kanchanu Karai Hoi Manoor N Kanchan Jhoorai.
translation: Philosopher's stone transforms metal into gold but the dross of iron does not become gold and is hence disappointed.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਵਨ ਬੋਹੈ ਬਨਾਸਪਤਿ ਬਾਂਸ ਨਿਗੰਧ ਨ ਬੁਹੈ ਹਜੂਰੈ
transliteration: Baavan Bohai Banaasapati Baansu Nigandh N Buhai Hajoorai.
translation: Sandalwood makes the whole vegetation fragrant but the nearby bamboo remains devoid of fragrance.

gurmukhi: ਖੇਤੀ ਜੰਮੈ ਸਹਸ ਗੁਣ ਕਲਰ ਖੇਤਿ ਨ ਬੀਜ ੳੁਗੂਰੈ
transliteration: Khaytee Janmai Sahans Goun Kalar Khayti N Beej Angooray.
translation: On sowing seed, the earth produces thousand times more but in the alkaline soil the seed does not germinate.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਲੂ ਸੁਝ ਨ ਸੁਝੲੀ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸੁਝ ਸੁਝਾੲਿ ਹਜੂਰੈ
transliteration: Uloo Sujh N Sujhaee Satiguru Sujh Sujhaai Hajooray.
translation: The owl cannot see (the sun) but the true Guru bestowing the understanding about that Lord makes one see Him really and clearly.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ਬੀਜੈ ਸੋ ਲੁਣੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸੇਵਾ ਸਭ ਫਲ ਚੂਰੈ
transliteration: Dharatee Beejai Su Lounai Satiguru Sayvaa Sabh Phal Choorai.
translation: Only that which is sown in the earth is reaped but by serving the true Guru all sorts of fruits are attained.

gurmukhi: ਬੋਹਿਥ ਪਵੈ ਸੁ ਨਿਕਲੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਾਧੁ ਅਸਾਧੁ ਨ ਦੂਰੈ
transliteration: Bohid Pavai So Nikalai Satiguru Saadhu Asaadhu N Doorai.
translation: As whoever boards the ship gets across, similarly the true Guru makes no distinction between the virtuous

gurmukhi: ਪਸੂ ਪਰੇਤਹੁਂ ਦੇਵ ਵਿਚੂਰੈ ||੩||
transliteration: Pasoo Paraytahu Dayv Vichoorai ?3?
translation: And the wicked and makes even animals and ghosts follow a godly life.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸ੍ਰੇਸ਼ਟਤਾ
translation: Greatness of the true Guru

gurmukhi: ਕੰਚਨ ਹੋਵੇ ਪਾਰਸਹੁਂ ਕੰਚਨ ਕਰੈ ਨ ਕੰਚਨ ਹੋਰੀ
transliteration: Kanchanu Hovai Paarasahu Kanchan Karai N Kanchan Horee.
translation: Gold is made by the (touch of the) philosopher's stone but gold itself cannot produce gold.

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਬਾਵਨ ਚੰਦਨਹੁਂ ਓਦੂੰ ਹੋਰੁ ਨ ਪਵੈ ਕਰੋਰੀ
transliteration: Chandan Baavan Chandanahu Aodoon Horu N Pavai Karoree.
translation: Sandal tree makes other tree fragrant but the latter cannot further make other trees fragrant.

gurmukhi: ਵੁਠੈ ਜੰਮੈ ਬੀਜਿਅਾ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਮਤਿ ਚਿਤਵੈ ਫਲ ਭੋਰੀ
transliteration: Voutdai Janmai Beejiaa Satiguru Mati Chitavai Phal Bhoree.
translation: Sown seed sprouts only after it rains but adopting the teachings of the Guru, one attain fruit instantly.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਤਿ ਪਵੈ ਦਿਹੁ ਅਾਥਵੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਪੂਰਣ ਧੁਰ ਧੋਰੀ
transliteration: Raati Pavai Dihu Aadavai Satiguru Guru Pooran Dhur Dhoree.
translation: The sun sets at the fall of night but the perfect Guru is there all the time.

gurmukhi: ਬੋਹਿਥ ਪਰਬਤ ਨਾ ਚੜ੍ਹੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਹਠ ਨਿਗ੍ਹੁ ਨ ਲਹੋਰੀ
transliteration: Bohid Parabat Naa Charhhai Satiguru Hatd Nigrahu N Sahoree.
translation: As a ship cannot mount the mountain forcibly similarly, forced control over the senses is not liked by the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ਨੋ ਭੁੰਚਾਲ ਡਰ ਗੁਰੁਮਤਿ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਚਲੈ ਨ ਚੋਰੀ
transliteration: Dharatee No Bhounchaal Dar Guru Mati Nihachal Chalai N Choree.
translation: The earth may be scared of a quake and it becomes restive in its place but the Gurmat, Guru's tenets are steadfast and unconcealed.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਰਤਨ ਪਦਾਰਥ ਬੋਰੀ ||੪||
transliteration: Satigur Ratan Padaarad Boree ?4?
translation: The true Guru, in fact, is a bag full of jewels.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਤ ਤੋਂ ਬਲਿਹਾਰ
translation: Sacrifice unto holy congregation

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਚੜਿਅੈ ਜਾਨਿ ਲੁਕ ੳੁਲੂ ਅੰਧ ਕੰਧ ਜਗ ਮਾਹੀ
transliteration: Sooraj Charhiai Louk Jaani Uloo Andh Kandh Jagi Maahee.
translation: On sun-rise, the owls blind like wall hide themselves in the world.

gurmukhi: ਬੁਕੇ ਸਿੰਘ ੳੁਦਿਅਾਨ ਮਹਿ ਜੰਬੁਕ ਮਿਰਗ ਨ ਖੋਜੇ ਪਾਹੀ
transliteration: Boukay Singh Udiaan Mahi Janbouk Mirag N Khojay Paahee.
translation: When the lion roars in the jungle, the jackals, deer etc. are not found around.

gurmukhi: ਚੜ੍ਹਿਅਾ ਚੰਦ ਅਕਾਸ ਤੇ ਵਿਚਿ ਕੁਨਾਲੀ ਲੁਕੈ ਨਾਹੀ
transliteration: Charhhiaa Chand Akaas Tay Vichi Kounaalee Loukai Naahee.
translation: Moon in the sky cannot be concealed behind a small plate.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਖੀ ਜੇਤੇ ਬਨ ਬਿਖੈ ਡਿਠੇ ਬਾਜ ਨ ਠੳੁਰਿ ਰਹਾਹੀ
transliteration: Pankhee Jaytay Ban Bikhai Ditday Baaj N Tdauri Rahaahee.
translation: Seeing a hawk all the birds in the forest leave their places and become restive (and flutter for their safety).

gurmukhi: ਚੋਰ ਜਾਰ ਹਰਾਮਖੋਰ ਦਿਹੁ ਚੜ੍ਹਿਅਾ ਕੋ ਦਿਸੈ ਨਾਹੀ
transliteration: Chor Jaar Haraamakhor Dihu Charhhiaa Ko Disai Naahee.
translation: Thieves, adulterers and corrupt ones are not seen around after day break.

gurmukhi: ਜਿਨ ਕੇ ਰਿਦੈ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਹੋੲਿ ਲਖ ਅਗਿਅਾਨੀ ਸੁਧ ਕਰਾਹੀ
transliteration: Jin Kay Ridai Giaan Hoi Lakh Agiaanee Sudh Karaahee.
translation: Those, who have knowledge in their heart improve the intellect of lacs of ignorants.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਕੈ ਦਰਸਨੈ ਕਲਿ ਕਲੇਸਿ ਸਭ ਬਿਨਸ ਬਿਨਾਹੀ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Kai Darasanai Kali Kalaysi Sabh Binas Binaahee.
translation: The glimpse of the holy congregation decimates all the tensions suffered in the kaliyug, the dark age.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਟਹੁ ਬਲਿ ਜਾਹੀ ||੫||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Vitahu Bali Jaahee ?5?
translation: I am sacrifice unto the holy congrega­tion.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਸਾਧਸੰਗ ਧੰਨ ਹੈ
translation: Blest is the holy congregation

gurmukhi: ਰਾਤਿ ਹਨ੍ਹੇਰੀ ਚਮਕਦੇ ਲਖ ਕਰੋੜੀ ਅੰਬਰਿ ਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Raati Hanhayree Chamakaday Lakh Karorhee Anbari Taaray.
translation: The lacs of stars shine in the dark night but with the moon rise they become dim.

gurmukhi: ਚੜ੍ਹਿਅੈ ਚੰਦ ਮਲੀਣ ਹੋੲਿ ਕੋ ਲੁਕੈ ਕੋ ਬੁਕੈ ਬਬਾਰੇ
transliteration: Charhhiai Chand Maleen Honi Ko Loukai Ko Boukai Babaaray.
translation: Some of them go in hiding while some continue to twinkle.

gurmukhi: ਸੂਰਜ ਜੋਤਿ ੳੁਦੋਤ ਕਰਿ ਤਾਰੇ ਚੰਦ ਨ ਰੈਣ ਅੰਧਾਰੇ
transliteration: Sooraj Joti Udoti Kari Taaray Chand N Raini Andhaaray.
translation: With the sun rise, the stars, the moon and the dark night, all vanish.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਨ ਸੈਵਕਾਂ ਤੰਤ ਨ ਮੰਤ ਨ ਫੁਰਨ ਵਿਚਾਰੇ
transliteration: Dayvee Dayv N Sayvakaan Tant N Mant N Dhurani Vichaaray.
translation: Before the servants, accomplished through the word of the true Guru, four vamas and four ashrams (astclhätu), the Vedas, Katebas are negligible

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਕਤੇਬਾਂ ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤ ਪੂਰੈ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸਬਦ ਸਵਾਰੇ
transliteration: Vayd Katayb N Asat Dhaatu Pooray Satiguru Sabad Savaaray.
translation: And the idea about gods, goddesses, their servants, tantra, mantra etc. does not even occur in the mind.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਸੁਹਾਵੜਾ ਧੰਨ ਗੁਰੂ ਧੰਨ ਗੁਰੂ ਪਿਅਾਰੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pand Suhaavarhaa Dhann Guroo Dhannu Guroo Piaaray.
translation: The way of gurmukhs is delightful. Blest is the Guru and also blessed are his beloved ones.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਪਰਗਟੁ ਸੰਸਾਰੇ ||੬||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Paragatu Sansaaray ?6?
translation: The glory of the holy congregation is manifest in the whole world.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦੇ ਗਾਹਕ
translation: Seekers of the true Guru

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰਿ ਵਰਨ ਚਾਰਿ ਮਜਹਬਾਂ ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨ ਵਰਤਨ ਵਰਤਾਰੇ
transliteration: Chaari Varani Chaari Majahabaan Chhia Darasan Varatani Varataaray.
translation: All the four vamas, four sects (of Muslims), six philosophies and their con­ducts,

gurmukhi: ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਹਜਾਰ ਨਾਵ ਥਾਨ ਮੁਕਾਮ ਸਭੇ ਵਣਜਾਰੇ
transliteration: Das Avataar Hajaar Naav Daan Moukaam Sabhay Vanajaaray.
translation: Ten incarnations, thousands of names of the Lord and all holy seats are His travelling traders.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਤੁ ਹਟਹੁਂ ਵਣਜ ਲੈ ਦੇਸ ਦਿਸੰਤਰਿ ਕਰਨਿ ਪਸਾਰੇ
transliteration: Ikatu Hatahu Vanaj Lai Days Disantari Karani Pasaaray.
translation: Having taken commodities from the store of that supreme reality, they spread them far and wide in the country and beyond.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਪੂਰਾ ਸਾਹੁ ਹੈ ਬੇਪਰਵਾਹੁ ਅਥਾਹ ਭੰਡਾਰੇ
transliteration: Satiguru Pooraa Saahu Hai Bayparavaahu Adaahu Bhandaaray.
translation: That carefree true Guru (Lord) is their perfect banker and His warehouses are unfathomable (and never ending).

gurmukhi: ਲੈ ਲੈ ਮੁਕਰ ਪਾਨਿ ਸਭ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਦੇੲਿ ਨ ਦੇਂਦਾ ਹਾਰੇ
transliteration: Lai Lai Moukari Paani Sabh Satiguru Dayi N Dayndaa Haaray.
translation: All take from Him and disavow but He, the true Guru, never gets tired bestowing gifts.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੁ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਸਵਾਰੇ
transliteration: Iku Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaari Akaar Savaaray.
translation: That Oankar Lord, extending His one vibrational sound, creates one and all.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਬਲਿਹਾਰੇ ||੭||
transliteration: Paarabraham Satigur Balihaaray ?7?
translation: I am sacrifice unto this trancendental Brahm in the form of true Guru.

gurmukhi: ੮ ਬਿਨਾ ਗੁਰੂ ਗਤਿ ਨਹੀਂ
translation: No liberation without Guru

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਪੈਕੰਬਰ ਅੌਲੀੲੇ ਗੌਸ ਕੁਤਬ ੳੁਲਮਾੳੁ ਘਨੇਰੇ
transliteration: Peer Paikanbar Auleeay Gaous Koutab Ulamaau Ghanayray.
translation: Many are the pirs, prophets, auliyas, gauris, qutubs and ulemas (all spiritual designations among Muslims).

gurmukhi: ਸੇਖ ਮਸਾੲਿਕ ਸਾਦਕਾ ਸੁਹਦੇ ਅੌਰੁ ਸਹੀਦ ਬਹੁਤੇਰੇ
transliteration: Saykh Masaaik Saadakaa Suhaday Aur Saheed Bahoutayray.
translation: Many shaikhs, sadiks(contented ones), and martyrs are there. Many are Qazis mullahs, maulavis (all Muslim religious and judicial designations).

gurmukhi: ਕਾਜੀ ਮੁਲਾਂ ਮੳੁਲਵੀ ਮੁਫਤੀ ਦਾਨਸਵੰਦ ਬੰਦੇਰੇ
transliteration: Kaajee Mulaan Maulavee Mudhatee Daanasavand Bandayray.
translation: (Similarly among the Hindus) Rsis, munis, Jain Digambars (Jain naked ascetics) and many miracle-makers knowing black magic are also known in this world.

gurmukhi: ਰਿਖੀ ਮੁਨੀ ਦਿਗੰਬਰਾ ਕਾਲਖ ਕਰਾਮਾਤ ਅਗਲੇਰੇ
transliteration: Rikhee Mounee Diganbaraan Kaalakh Karaamaat Agalayray.
translation: Innumerable are the practising, siddhs (yogis) who publicise themselves as great persons.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਕ ਸਿਧ ਅਗਣਤ ਹੈਨਿ ਅਾਪ ਜਣਾੲਿਨਿ ਵਡੇ ਵਡੇਰੇ
transliteration: Saadhik Sidhi Aganat Haini Aap Janaaini Vaday Vadayray.
translation: None gets liberated without the true Guru without whom their ego goes on increasing further,

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨੁ ਗੁਰ ਕੋੲਿ ਨ ਸਿਝੲੀ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਵਧਦੀ ਜਾੲਿ ਵਧੇਰੇ
transliteration: Binu Gur Koi N Sijhaee Haoumain Vadhadee Jaai Vadhayray.
translation: Without holy congregation, the sense of ego stares at the jtv menacingly,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਬਿਨੁ ਹੳੁਮੈ ਹੇਰੇ ||੮||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Binu Haoumai Hayray ?8?
translation: I am sacrifice unto this trancendental Brahm in the form of true Guru.

gurmukhi: ੯ ਹੳੁਮੈ -ਓਅੰਕਾਰ
translation: All gifts are with the grace of Oankaar, the Lord -

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸੈ ਰਿਧਿ ਸਿਧਿ ਕਿਸੈ ਦੇੲਿ ਕਿਸੈ ਨਿਧਿ ਕਰਾਮਾਤ ਸੁ ਕਿਸੈ
transliteration: Kisai Ridhi Sidhi Kisai Dayi Kisai Nidhi Karaamaat Su Kisai.
translation: Upon some He bestows miraculous powers (riddhis, siddhis) and to some He gives wealth and to some other miracles.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸੈ ਰਸਾੲਿਣ ਕਿਸੈ ਮਣਿ ਕਿਸਿ ਪਾਰਸ ਕਿਸੈ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਰਿਸੈ
transliteration: Kisai Rasaain Kisai Mani Kisai Paaras Kisai Anmrit Risai.
translation: To some He gives life-elixir, to some the fabulous gem, to some the philosopher's stone and due to His grace in the inner self of some trickles the nectar;

gurmukhi: ਤੰਤੁ ਮੰਤੁ ਪਾਖੰਡ ਕਿਸੈ ਵੀਰਾਰਾਧ ਦਿਸੰਤਰੁ ਦਿਸੈ
transliteration: Tantu Mantu Paakhand Kisai Veeraaraadh Disantaru Disai.
translation: Some in His will practise tantra mantra hypocrisies and worship of Vas (S aivite worship) and some others He causes to wander in far off places.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਸੈ ਕਾਮਧੇਨੁ ਪਾਰਿਜਾਤ ਕਿਸੈ ਲਖਮੀ ਦੇਵੈ ਜਿਸੈ
transliteration: Kisai Kaamadhaynu Paarijaat Kisai Lakhamee Dayvai Jisai.
translation: Upon some He bestows the wishfulfilling cow, upon some the wishfulfilling tree and on whomsoever He likes He bestows Laksami (goddess of wealth).

gurmukhi: ਨਾਟਕ ਚੇਟਕ ਅਾਸਣਾ ਨਿਵਲੀ ਕਰਮ ਭਰਮ ਭੳੁ ਮਿਸੈ
transliteration: Naatak Chaytak Aasanaa Nivalee Karam Bharam Bhau Misai.
translation: To delude many, He gives asans (postures), niolf kannas --the yogic exercises, and miracles and dramatic activities to many a person.

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗੀ ਭੋਗੀ ਜੋਗੁ ਭੋਗੁ ਸਦਾ ਸੰਜੋਗੁ ਵਿਜੋਗੁ ਸਲਿਸੈ
transliteration: Jogee Bhogee Jogu Bhogu Sadaa Sanjogu Vijogu Salisai.
translation: He gives asceticism to yogis and luxuries to bhogis (enjoyers of the wordly pleasures).

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਸੁ ਤਿਸੈ ||੯||
transliteration: Aoankaari Akaar Su Tisai ?9?
translation: Meeting and parting i.e. taking birth and dying always cojointly exist. These all are (various) forms of Oankar.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਮਾਣਸ ਜਨਮੋਤਮਤਾ
translation: Excellence of human birth

gurmukhi: ਖਾਣੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਜੁਗ ਚਾਰਿ ਲਖ ਚੳੁਰਾਸੀਹ ਜੂਨਿ ੳੁਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Khaanee Baanee Jougi Chaari Lakh Chauraaseeh Jooni Oupaaee.
translation: Four ages, four mines of life, four speeches (para, pasyanti, madhyama and vaikhari) and creatures living in lacs of species

gurmukhi: ੳੁਤਮ ਜੂਨਿ ਵਖਾਣੀਅੈ ਮਾਨਸ ਜੂਨਿ ਦੁਲੰਭ ਦਿਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Outam Jooni Vakhaaneeai Maanasi Jooni Dulabh Dikhaaee.
translation: He has created. Human species known to be a rare one is the best of ail the species.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਜੂਨੀ ਕਰਿ ਵਸ ਤਿਸੁ ਮਾਣਸ ਨੋ ਦਿਤੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sabhi Jooni Kari Vasi Tisu Maanasi No Ditee Vadiaaee.
translation: Making all the species subordinate to human species, the Lord has given it superiority.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੁਤੇ ਮਾਣਸ ਜਗਤ ਵਿਚਿ ਪਰਾਧੀਨ ਕਿਛੁ ਸਮਝ ਨ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Bahoutay Maanas Jagat Vichi Paraadheen Kichhu Samajhi N Paaee.
translation: Most of the human beings in the world remain subordinated to each other and are unable to understand anything.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਨ ਮੈ ਸੋ ਅਾਧੀਨ ਜੋ ਮੰਦੀ ਕੰਮੀ ਜਨਮੁ ਗਵਾੲੀ
transliteration: Tin Mai So Aadheen Ko Mandee Kanmeen Janamu Gavaaee.
translation: Among them, those are real slaves who have lost their lives in evil deeds.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤ ਦੇ ਵੁਠਿਅਾਂ ਲਖ ਚੳਰਾਸੀ ਫੇਰਿ ਮਿਟਾੲੀ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Day Voutdiaan Lakh Chauraaseeh Dhayri Mitaaee.
translation: The transmigration in the eighty four lac species of life is ended if the holy congregation is pleased.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਬਦੀ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੧੦||
transliteration: Guru Sabadee Vadee Vadiaaee ?10?
translation: Real excellence is achieved by cultivating the Guru's word.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਗਾਡੀ ਰਾਹ ਨਿੱਤ ਕ੍ਰਿਯਾ
translation: The highway - daily conduct of the gurmukh  (

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਭਲਕੇ ੳੁਠ ਕਰਿ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਵੇਲੇ ਸਰੁ ਨ੍ਹਾਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Gurasikh Bhalakay Outd Kari Anmrit Vaylay Saru Nhaavandaa.
translation: The gurmukh getting up in arobrosial hours of the early morning takes bath in the sacred tank.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਕੈ ਬਚਨ ੳੁਚਾਰਿ ਕੈ ਧ੍ਰਮਸਾਲਾ ਦੀ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Guru Kai Bachan Ouchaari Kai Dharamasaal Dee Surati Karandaa.
translation: Reciting the holy hymns of the Guru, he moves towards gurudvara, the central place for Sikh.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਿਚਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ਦੇ ਪ੍ਰੀਤਿ ਸੁਣੰਦਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Vichi Jaai Kai Gurabaanee Day Preeti Sounandaa.
translation: There, joining the holy congregation,he lovingly listens to Gurbant, the holy hymns of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਕਾ ਮਨਹੁਂ ਮਿਟਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖਾਂ ਦੀ ਸੇਵ ਕਰੰਦਾ
transliteration: Sankaa Manahu Mitaai Kai Guru Sikhaan Dee Sayv Karandaa.
translation: Effacing all doubt from his mind he serves the Sikhs of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਕਿਰਤ ਵਿਰਤ ਕਰਿ ਧਰਮੁ ਦੀ ਲੈ ਪਰਸਾਦ ਅਾਣਿ ਵਰਤੰਦਾ
transliteration: Kirat Virat Kari Dharamu Dee Lai Parasaad Aani Varatandaa.
translation: Then by righteous means he earns his livelihood and he distributes the hard-earned meal among the needy ones.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖਾਂ ਨੋ ਦੇੲਿ ਕਰਿ ਪਿਛੋਂ ਬਚਿਅਾ ਅਾਪ ਖਵੰਦਾ
transliteration: Gurasikhaan No Dayi Kari Pichhon Bachiaa Aapu Khavandaa.
translation: Offering first, to the Sikhs of Guru, the remainder he himself eats.

gurmukhi: ਕਲੀ ਕਾਲ ਪਰਗਾਸ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰੁ ਚੇਲਾ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰੁ ਸੰਦਾ
transliteration: Kalee Kaal Paragaas Kari Guru Chaylaa Guru Sandaa.
translation: In this dark age, illumined by such feelings, the disciple becomes Guru and the Guru disciple.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਗਾਡੀ ਰਾਹੁ ਚਲੰਦਾ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Guramoukh Gaadee Raahu Chaladaa ?11?
translation: The gurmukhs tread on such a highway (of religious life).

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਗੁਰ ਅਾਗਯਾ ਵਿਚ ਲੀਨ
translation: Absorbed in the will of the Guru

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਜਿਸੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਸਿਰੰਦਾ ਸੋੲੀ
transliteration: Aoankaar Akaaru Jisu Satiguru Purakhu Sirandaa Soee.
translation: The Oankar whose form is the true Guru, is the true creator of universe.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਜਿਸ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸਤਿਸੰਗ ਵਿਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Iku Kavaau Pasaau Jis Sabad Surati Satisang Viloee.
translation: From His one word the whole creation spreads, and in the holy congregation, the consciousness is merged in His word.

gurmukhi: ਬ੍ਹਮਾ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਮਹੇਸੁ ਮਿਲਿ ਦਸ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਵੀਚਾਰ ਨ ਹੋੲੀ
transliteration: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Mili Das Avataar Veechaar N Hoee.
translation: Even Brahma Visnu Mahes'a and the ten incarnations jointly, cannot ponder upon His mystery.

gurmukhi: ਭੇਦ ਨ ਬੇਦ ਕਤੇਬ ਨੋ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣ ਜਣੋੲੀ
transliteration: Bhayd N Bayd Katayb No Hindoo Mousalamaan Janoee.
translation: Vedas, Katebas, Hindus, Muslims - none knows His secrets.

gurmukhi: ੳੂਤਮ ਜਨਮ ਸਕਾਰਥਾ ਚਰਣ ਸਰਣ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਵਿਰਲੋੲੀ
transliteration: Outam Janamu Sakaaradaa Charani Sarani Satiguru Viraloee.
translation: Rare is a person who comes to the shelter of the feet of the true Guru and makes his life fruitful.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਸੁਣਿ ਗੁਰੁਸਿਖ ਹੋੲਿ ਮੁਰਦਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਸੁ ਕੋੲੀ
transliteration: Guru Sikh Souni Gurousikh Hoi Muradaa Hoi Mureed Su Koee.
translation: Rare is a person who listening to the teachings of Guru becomes disciple, remains dead to passions, and prepares himself to be a true servant.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਗੋਰਿਸਤਾਨ ਸਮੋੲੀ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Satiguru Gorisataan Samoee ?12?
translation: Any rare one absorbs himself in graveyard (i.e. permanent haven) of the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੁਭ ਸਾਧਕ ਤੋਂ ਵਡੇ ਹਨ
translation: All except the Sikhs of the Guru are wandering in delusions

gurmukhi: ਜਪ ਤਪ ਹਠ ਨਿਗ੍ਹ ਘਣੇ ਚੳੁਦਹ ਵਿਦਿਅਾ ਵੇਦ ਵਖਾਣੇ
transliteration: Jap Tap Hatdi Nigrah Ghanay Chaudah Vidiaa Vayd Vakhaanay.
translation: Recitations, austerities, persistences, many renunciaitions explanations on Vedas and all the fourteen skills are known in the world.

gurmukhi: ਸੇਖ ਨਾਗ ਸਨਾਕਾਦਿਕਾ ਲੋਮਸ ਅੰਤ ਅਨੰਤ ਨ ਜਾਣੇ
transliteration: Saykh Naag Sanakaadikaan Lomas Antu Anat N Jaanay.
translation: Even Sesanag, Sanaks, and rishi Lomas do not know the mystery of that infinite.

gurmukhi: ਜਤੀ ਸਤੀ ਸੰਤੋਖੀਅਾ ਸਿਧ ਨਾਥ ਹੁੲਿ ਨਾਥ ਭੁਲਾਣੇ
transliteration: Jatee Satee Santokheeaan Sidh Naad Hoi Naad Bhulaanay.
translation: Celebates, follower of truth, contented ones, siddhs, naths(yogis) all becoming master­less are wandering in delusions.

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਪੈਕੰਬਰ ਅੳੁਲੀੲੇ ਬੁਜਰਕਵਾਰ ਹਜਾਰ ਹੈਰਾਣੈ
transliteration: Peer Paikanbar Auleeay Bujarakavaar Hajaar Hairaanay.
translation: Searching Him all the pars, prophets, auliyas and thousands of old men are wonderstruck (because they could not know Him).

gurmukhi: ਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਲਖ ਰੋਗ ਸੋਗ ਲਖ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਵਿਜੋਗ ਵਿਡਾਣੇ
transliteration: Jog Bhog Lakh Rog Sog Lakh Sanjog Vijog Vidaanay.
translation: Yogas (austerties), bhogs (joys), lacs of ailments, sufferings and sepa­rations, all are illusions.

gurmukhi: ਦਸ ਨਾੳੁ ਸਨਿਅਾਸੀਅਾਂ ਭੰਭਲ ਭੂਸੇ ਖਾੲਿ ਭੁਲਾਣੇ
transliteration: Das Naaoun Sanniaaseeaan Bhanbhal Bhoosay Khaai Bhulaanay.
translation: Ten sects of sannyasis are wandering in delusions.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਜੋਗੀ ਜਾਗਦੇ ਹੋਰ ਸਭੇ ਬਨਵਾਸ ਲੁਕਾਣੇ
transliteration: Guru Sikh Jogee Jaagaday Hor Sabhay Banavaasu Loukaanay.
translation: Disciple yogis of the Guru always remain alert whereas others have hidden themselves in the jungles, i.e. they are unconcerned with the problems of the world.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਨਾਮ ਵਖਾਣੇ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Mili Naamu Vakhaanay ?13?
translation: Joining the holy congregation, the Sikhs of the Guru eulogize the glory of the name of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਸਿਖਯਾ
translation: Teachings of the true Guru

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦ ਸੂਰਜ ਲਖ ਚਾਨਣੇ ਤਿਲ ਨ ਪੁਜਨਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਮਤੀ
transliteration: Chand Sooraj Lakh Chaananay Til N Pujani Satiguru Matee.
translation: The light of lacs of moons and suns cannot become equal to an iota of the wisdom of the true Guru.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਪਾਤਾਲ ਅਕਾਸ ਲਖ ੳੁਚੀ ਨੀਵੀ ਕਿਰਣ ਨ ਰਤੀ
transliteration: Lakh Paataal Akaas Lakh Ouchee Neeveen Kirani N Ratee.
translation: Millions of nether worlds and millions of skies exist but there is not the slightest maladjustment in their alignment.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਪਾਣੀ ਲਖ ਪੳੁਣ ਮਿਲਿ ਰੰਗ ਬਿਰੰਗ ਤਰੰਗਨ ਵਤੀ
transliteration: Lakh Paanee Lakh Paoun Mili Rang Birang Tarang N Vatee.
translation: Lacs of airs and waters join to create moving waves of different hues.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਨ ਅੰਤ ਨ ਮਧ ਪਲੁ ਲਖ ਪਰਲੳੁ ਲਖ ਲਖ ੳੁਤਪਤੀ
transliteration: Aadi N Antu N Mantu Palu Lakh Paralau Lakh Lakh Outapatee.
translation: Millions of creations and millions of dissolutions continuously alternate without the beginning, middle and end of the process.

gurmukhi: ਧੀਰਜ ਧਰਮ ਨ ਪੁਜਨੀ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਪਰਬਤ ਲਖ ਧਰਤੀ
transliteration: Dheeraj Dharam N Pujanee Lakh Lakh Parabat Lakh Dharatee.
translation: Lacs of forbearing earths and mountains cannot equate the teachings of the true Guru in perseverance and righteousness.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਲਖ ਤੁਲਿ ਨ ਤੁਲੀਅੈ ਤਿਲ ਗੁਰਮਤੀ
transliteration: Lakh Giaan Dhiaan Lakh Tuli N Tuleeai Til Guramatee.
translation: Millions types of knowledges and meditations are not equal to even a particle of the knowledge of the wisdom of Guru (gunnat).

gurmukhi: ਸਿਮਰਣ ਕਿਰਣਿ ਘਣੀਂ ਘੋਲ ਘਤੀ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Simaran Kirani Ghanee Ghol Ghatee ?14?
translation: I have sacrified Lacs of rays of lights for one ray of the meditation upon the Lord.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਬੰਦੇ
translation: Rare servants

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਲਹਿਰ ਤਰੰਗ ੳੁਠੰਦੇ
transliteration: Lakh Dareeaau Kavaau Vichi Lakh Lakh Lahari Tarang Outdaday.
translation: In the one word of the Lord lacs of rivers (of life) flow and lacs of waves come up in them.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਸ ਲਹਰ ਤਰੰਗ ਵਿਚਿ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਵਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Ikas Lahari Tarang Vichi Lakh Lakh Lakh Dareeaau Vahanday.
translation: In His one wave again, lacs of rivers (of life) flow.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕਸ ੲਿਕਸ ਦਰੀਅਾੳੁ ਵਿਚਿ ਲਖ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਫਿਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Ikas Ikas Dareeaau Vichi Lakh Avataar Akaar Dhiranday.
translation: In each river, in the form of incarnations, lacs of jivs assuming many forms are roaming about.

gurmukhi: ਮਛ ਕਛ ਮਰਿਜੀਵੜੇ ਅਗਮ ਅਥਾਹ ਨ ਥਾਹ ਲਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Machh Kachh Marijeevarhay Agam Adaah N Haadi Lahanday.
translation: Incarnations in the form of fish and tortoise dive into it but they cannot fathom its depth, i.e. they cannot know the limits of that supreme reality.

gurmukhi: ਪਰਵਦਗਾਰ ਅਪਾਰ ਹੈ ਪਾਰਾਵਾਰ ਨ ਲਹਿਰ ਤਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Paravadagaar Apaaru Hai Paaraavaar N Lahani Taranday.
translation: That sustainer Lord is beyond all limits; none can know the bounds of his waves.

gurmukhi: ਅਜਰਾਵਰ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਗੁਰੁਸਿਖ ਅਜਰ ਜਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Ajaraavaru Satiguru Purakhu Guramati Guru Sikh Ajaru Jaranday.
translation: That true Guru is the excellent purus and the disciples of the Guru bear the unbearable, through the wisdom of the Guru (gurmat).

gurmukhi: ਕਰਨ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਬੰਦੇ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Karani Bandagee Viralay Banday ?15?
translation: Rare are the people who undertake such devotional worship.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖ
translation: Primeval Lord

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਅਮਾੳੁ ਜਿਸ ਕੇਵਡੁ ਵਡੇ ਦੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Ik Kavaau Amaau Jisu Kayvadu Vaday Dee Vadiaaee.
translation: What could be said about the greatness of that great Lord whose one word is beyond all measures.

gurmukhi: ਓਅੰਕਾਰ ਅਕਾਰ ਜਿਸੁ ਤਿਸੁ ਦਾ ਅੰਤੁ ਨ ਕੋੳੂ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Aoankaar Akaar Jisu Tisu Daa Antu N Kooo Paaee.
translation: None can know His mystery whose base is only One Gallia". How could His long life be counted whose half a breath is unfathom­able.

gurmukhi: ਅਧਾ ਸਾਹੁ ਅਥਾਹੁ ਜਿਸੁ ਵਡੀ ਅਾਰਜਾ ਗਣਤ ਨ ਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Adhaa Saahu Adaahu Jisu Vadee Aarajaa Ganat N Aaee.
translation: His creation cannot be evaluated; how can then that imperceptible one be beholden (understood).

gurmukhi: ਕੁਦਰਤਿ ਕੀਮ ਨ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਕਾਦਰੁ ਅਲਖੁ ਨ ਲਖਿਅਾ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Kudarati Keem N Jaaneeai Kaadaru Alakhu N Lakhiaa Jaaee.
translation: His gifts such as days and nights are also invalu­able and His other boons are also infinite.

gurmukhi: ਦਾਤਿ ਨ ਕੀਮ ਨ ਰਾਤਿ ਦਿਹੁ ਬੇਸੁਮਾਰ ਦਾਤਾਰੁ ਖੁਦਾੲੀ
transliteration: Daati N Keem N Raati Dihu Baysoumaaru Daataaru Khudaaee.
translation: Indescribable is the position of the Lord, the master of the masterless,

gurmukhi: ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਅਨਾਥ ਨਾਥ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਨੇਤਿ ਨੇਤਿ ਅਲਾੲੀ
transliteration: Abigati Gati Anaad Naad Akad Kadaa Nayti Nayti Alaaee.
translation: And His unnarratable story can only be concluded by saying neti neti (this is not, this not).

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦੇਸੁ ਕਰਾੲੀ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Karaaee ?16?
translation: Worthy of salutation is only that primeval Lord.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਕਰਮ ਨਿਖੇਧ
translation: Condemnation of worthless actions

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਵਿਸ਼ੇਖਤਾ
translation: Condemnation of worthless actions

gurmukhi: ਸਿਰ ਕਲਵਤੁ ਲੈ ਲਖ ਵਾਰ ਹੋਮੇ ਕਟਿ ਕਟਿ ਤਿਲੁ ਤਿਲੁ ਦੇਹੀ
transliteration: Siru Kalavatu Lai Lakh Vaar Homay Kati Kati Tilu Tilu Dayhee.
translation: If a saw is held one's head and the body is cut piece by piece to be put as burnt offerings;

gurmukhi: ਗਲੈ ਹਿਮਾਚਲ ਲਖ ਵਾਰਿ ਕਰੈ ੳੁਰਧ ਤਪ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਸਨੇਹੀ
transliteration: Galai Himaachal Lakh Vaari Karai Uradh Tap Jougati Sanayhee.
translation: If lacs of times one gets decayed in snow or adopting proper techniques one undertakes penances with body upside down;

gurmukhi: ਜਲ ਤਪ ਸਾਧੈ ਅਗਨਿ ਤਪ ਅਰਧ ਤਾਪ ਕਰਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਵਿਦੇਹੀ
transliteration: Jal Tapu Saadhay Agani Tapu Pooar Tapu Kari Hoi Vidayhee.
translation: If one becomes bodyless through water penances, fire-penances, and internal fire-penances;

gurmukhi: ਵਰਤ ਨੇਮ ਸੰਜਮ ਘਣੇ ਦੇਵੀ ਦੇਵ ਅਸਥਾਨ ਭਵੇਹੀ
transliteration: Varat Naym Sanjam Ghanay Dayvee Dayv Asadaan Bhavayhee.
translation: If one practises fasts, rules, disciplines and wanders about the places of gods and goddesses;

gurmukhi: ਪੁੰਨ ਦਾਨ ਚੰਗਿਅਾੲੀਅਾਂ ਸਿਧਾਸਣ ਸਿੰਘਾਸਣ ਬੇਹੀ
transliteration: Pounn Daan Changiaaeeaan Sidhaasan Singhaasan Day Ayhee.
translation: If one makes throne of virtuous charities, goodness and lotus postures and sits on it;

gurmukhi: ਨਿਵਲੀ ਕਰਮ ਭੁੲਿਅੰਗਮਾ ਪੂਰਕ ਕੁੰਭਕ ਰੇਚ ਕਰੇਹੀ
transliteration: Nivalee Karam Bhuiangamaan Poorak Kounbhak Raych Karayhee.
translation: If one practises nioli karma, serpent posture, exhalation, inhalation and suspension of vital air (pranayam);

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਸਰ ਨ ਸਭੇਹੀ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Sarani Sabhayhee ?17?
translation: All these to­gether are not equal to the fruit of delight attained by the gurmukh.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਸ ਸਿਅਾਣੇ ਸੈ ਪੁਰਸ ਸਹਸ ਸਿਅਾਣਪ ਲੲਿਅਾ ਨ ਜਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sahas Siaanay Saipuras Sahas Siaanap Laiaa N Jaaee.
translation: Millions of wisemen through their skills cannot attain the (supreme) fruit of delight.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਸ ਸੁਘੜ ਸੁਘੜਾੲੀਅਾਂ ਤੁਲੁ ਨ ਸਹਸ ਚਤੁਰ ਚਤੁਰਾੲੀ
transliteration: Sahas Sougharh Sougharhaaeeaan Tulu N Sahas Chatur Chaturaaee.
translation: Millions of skillful persons with their skills and thousands of clever persons with their cleverness cannot attain Him.

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਹਕੀਮ ਲਖ ਹਿਕਮਤੀ ਦੁਨੀਅਾਂਦਾਰ ਵਡੇ ਦੁਨਿਅਾੲੀ
transliteration: Lakh Hakeem Lakh Hikamatee Douneeaadaar Vaday Douniaaee.
translation: Lacs of physicians, lacs of ingenious persons and other worldly wise people;

gurmukhi: ਲਖ ਸਾਹ ਪਤਿਸਾਹ ਲਖ ਲਖ ਵਜੀਰ ਨ ਮਸਲਤ ਕਾੲੀ
transliteration: Lakh Saah Patisaah Lakh Lakh Vajeer N Masalat Kaaee.
translation: Lacs of kings, emperors and of their minister in lacs are there but no suggestion of anybody is of any use.

gurmukhi: ਜਤੀ ਸਤੀ ਸੰਤੋਖੀਅਾ ਸਿਧ ਨਾਥ ਮਿਲਿ ਹਾਥ ਨ ਪਾੲੀ
transliteration: Jatee Satee Santokheeaan Sidh Naad Mili Haad N Paaee.
translation: Celebates, truthful and contented ones, siddhs, naths, none could lay his hand upon Him.

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰ ਵਰਨ ਚਾਰ ਮਜਹਬਾ ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨ ਨਹਿਂ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲੀ
transliteration: Chaar Varan Chaar Majahabaan Chhia Darasan Nahi Alakhu Lakhaaee.
translation: None, including four varnas, four sects and six philoso­phies could behold that imperceptible Lord's fruit of delight.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਵਡੀ ਵਡਿਅਾੲੀ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Vadee Vadiaaee ?18?
translation: Great is the glory of the fruit of delight of the gurmukhs.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦੀ
translation: Master and discipleship

gurmukhi: ਪੀਰ ਮੁਰੀਦੀ ਗਾਖੜੀ ਪੀਰਾਂ ਪੀਰੁ ਗੁਰਾਂ ਗੁਰੁ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Peer Mureedee Gaakharhee Peeraan Peeru Guraan Guru Jaanai.
translation: Discipleship of the Guru is a difficult task; any pir or Guru of the Gurus knows it.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਦਾ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਲੈ ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ
transliteration: Satiguru Daa Oupadaysu Lai Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Siaanai.
translation: Accepting the teachings of the true Guru and going beyond the wordly illusions He identifies that Lord.

gurmukhi: ਮੁਰਦਾ ਹੋੲਿ ਮੁਰੀਦ ਸੋ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਜਾੲਿ ਸਮਾੲਿ ਬਬਾਣੈ
transliteration: Muradaa Hoi Mureed So Guru Sikh Jaai Samaai Babaanai.
translation: Only that Sikh of the Guru absorbs his self into Baba (Nanak) who has become dead to his carnal desires.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀਂ ਪੈ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਹੋੲਿ ਤਿਸੁ ਪਾਖਾਕ ਪਾਕੁ ਪਤੀਅਾਣੈ
transliteration: Paireen Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Tisu Paa Khaak Paaku Pateeaanai.
translation: Fall­ing at the Guru's feet he becomes the dust of his feet; people consider such dust of the feet of a humble Sikh as sacred.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਅਗੰਮੁ ਹੈ ਮਰਿ ਮਰਿ ਜੀਵੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਪਛਾਣੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pandu Aganmu Hai Mari Mari Jeevai Jaai Pachhaanai.
translation: Unapproachable is the way of gurmukhs; while being dead they remain alive (i.e. they make only their desires dead), and ultimately they identify the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੁ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਅਵੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਕੀੜੀ ਭ੍ਰਿੰਗੀ ਵਾਂਗ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Guru Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Keerhee Bhringee Vaang Vidaanai.
translation: Inspired by the teach­ings of the Guru and adopting the conduct of bhritigi insect (which trans­forms small ant into bhringt), he (the disciple) attains the grandeur and great­ness of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਕੳੁਣ ਅਾਖਿ ਵਖਾਣੈ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Akad Kadaa Kaoun Aakhi Vakhaanai ?19?
translation: Who, in fact, can describe this ineffable story?

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ
translation: Fruit of delight

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰ ਵਰਨ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗ ਚਾਰ ਚਵਕਾ ਸੋਲਹਿ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Chaari Varani Mili Saadhasangi Chaar Chavakaa Solahi Jaanai.
translation: After coming to holy congregation all the four varnas (castes) become four time more powerful i.e. they become perfect sixteen types of skills in them,

gurmukhi: ਪੰਜ ਸਬਦ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਲਿਵ ਪੰਜੂ ਪੰਜੇ ਪੰਜੀਹ ਲਾਣੈ
transliteration: Panj Sabad Gur Sabad Liv Panjoo Panjay Panjeeh Laanai.
translation: Absorbing consciousness in five qualities of word (pares, pa(yantl, madhyama, vaikharf and matrika), the jilt tames all the five times five, 1.e. twenty-five proclivities of human nature.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਣ ੲਿਕ ਦਰਸਣੋ ਛਿਅ ਛਕੇ ਛਤੀਹ ਸਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Chhia Darasan Ik Darasano Chhia Chhakay Chhateeh Samaanai.
translation: Subsuming six philosophies In the one philosophy of the Lord, thejtv comes to know about the significance of six times six, i.e. thirty six postures (of yoga).

gurmukhi: ਸਤ ਦੀਪ ੲਿਕ ਦੀਪਕੋ ਸਤ ਸਤੇ ੳੁਣਵੰਜਹਿ ਭਾਣੈ
transliteration: Sat Deep Ik Deepako Sat Satay Ounavanjahi Bhaanai.
translation: Beholding the light of one lamp in all the seven continents, forty nine (7x7) airs are controlled by fit),

gurmukhi: ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤ ੲਿਕੁ ਧਾਤ ਕਰਿ ਅਠੂ ਅਠੇ ਚੳੁਹਠ ਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaat Kari Atdoo Atday Chauhatd Maanai.
translation: The delight of sixty four skills is enjoyed when the asr dhatu in the form of four varnas and four ashrams associated with philosopher's stone in the form of (one) Guru is transformed into gold.

gurmukhi: ਨੳੁ ਨਾਥ ੲਿਕ ਨਾਥ ਹੈ ਨੳੁਂ ਨਾੲੇਂ ੲੇਕਾਸੀਹ ਦਾਣੈ
transliteration: Naoun Naad Ik Naad Hai Naoun Naaayn Aykaaseeh Daanai.
translation: By bowing before one master of the nine naths (masters), the knowledge about the eighty-one divisions (of cosmos) is attained.

gurmukhi: ਦਸ ਦੁਅਾਰ ਨਿਰਧਾਰ ਕਰਿ ਦਾਹੋ ਦਾਹੇ ਸੳੁ ਪਰਵਾਣੈ
transliteration: Das Duaar Niradhaar Kari Daaho Daahay Sau Paravaanai.
translation: Getting freedom from the ten doors (of body) the perfect yogi gets cent percent accepted (in the court of Lord).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖਫਲ ਚੋਜ ਵਿਡਾਣੈ ||੨੦||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Choj Vidaanai ?20?
translation: Gurmukhs' fruit of delight possesses a subtle mystique.

gurmukhi: ੨੧ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਮਹਿਮਾ
translation: Praises of the true Guru

gurmukhi: ਸੌ ਵਿਚ ਵਰਤੇ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਤ ੲਿਕੋਤਰ ਸੌ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਅਬਿਨਾਸੀ
transliteration: Sau Vich Varatai Sikh Sant Ikotar Sau Satigur Abinaasee.
translation: If the Sikh is hundred times, the eternal true Guru is hundred and one times.

gurmukhi: ਸਦਾ ਸਦੀਵ ਦੀਬਾਣ ਜਿਸ ਅਸਥਿਰ ਸਦਾ ਨ ਅਾਵੈ ਜਾਸੀ
transliteration: Sadaa Sadeev Deevaan Jisu Asadir Sadaa N Aavai Jaasee.
translation: His court is ever steadfast and he never undergoes the cycle of transmigra­tion.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਮਨ ਜਿਨ੍ਹੈਂ ਧਿਅਾੲਿਅਾ ਕਾਟੀ ਗਲਹੁ ਤਿਸੈ ਜਮ ਫਾਸੀ
transliteration: Ik Man Jinhain Dhiaaiaa Kaatee Galahu Tisai Jam Dhaasee.
translation: He who meditates upon Him with singleminded devotion, gets his noose of Yama, cut asunder.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕੋ ੲਿਕ ਵਰਤਦਾ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਜਣਾਸੀ
transliteration: Iko Ik Varatadaa Sabad Surati Satiguroo Janaasee.
translation: That one Lord alone pervades everywhere, and only by merging consciousness in the word that true Guru can be known.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਮੂਰਤੋ ਭ੍ਰਮਤਿ ਫਿਰੇ ਲਖ ਜੂਨ ਚੳੁਰਾਸੀ
transliteration: Binu Darasanu Guru Moorati Bhramataa Dhiray Lakh Jooni Chauraasee.
translation: Without the glimpse of the manifest Guru (the word of Guru), thefts, wanders in eightyfour lacs of species of life.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨੁ ਦੀਖਿਅਾ ਗੁਰਦੇਵ ਦੀ ਮਰਿ ਜਨਮੇ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਰਕ ਪਵਾਸੀ
transliteration: Binu Deekhiaa Guradayv Dee Mari Janamay Vichi Narak Pavaasee.
translation: Without the teachings of Guru, the jivgoes on taking birth and dying and is ultimately thrown in hell.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਰਗੁਣ ਸਰਗੁਣ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਕੋ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਸਮਾਸੀ
transliteration: Niragoun Saragoun Satiguroo Viralaa Ko Gur Sabad Samaasee.
translation: The true Guru (Lord) is without attributes and yet possesses all the qualities.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨੁ ਗੁਰੁ ਓਟ ਨ ਹੋਰੁ ਕੋ ਸਚੀ ਓਟ ਨ ਕਦੇ ਬਿਨਾਸੀ
transliteration: Binu Guru Aot N Horu Ko Sachee Aot N Kaday Binaasee.
translation: A rare one absorbes himself in the word of the Guru. There is no shelter without Guru's and this true refuge never gets destroyed.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਾਂ ਗੁਰੂ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਅਾਦਿ ਅੰਤਿ ਥਿਰੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਰਹਾਸੀ
transliteration: Guraan Guroo Satiguru Purakhu Aadi Anti Diru Guroo Rahaasee.
translation: The true Guru (Lord), Guru of all Gurus, is the immutable Guru from beginning to end.

gurmukhi: ਕੋ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਸੀ ||੨੧||
transliteration: Ko Viralaa Guramoukhi Sahaji Samaasee ?21?
translation: Any rare gurmukh gets merged in the equipoise.

gurmukhi: ੨੨ ਮੂਲ ਵਰਣਨ
translation: Basic description

gurmukhi: ਧਿਅਾਨ ਮੂਲ ਮੂਰਤ ਗੁਰੂ ਪੂਜਾ ਮੂਲ ਗੁਰੁ ਚਰਣ ਪੁਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Dhiaan Mool Moorati Guroo Poojaa Mool Guru Charan Pujaaay.
translation: Basis of meditation is the form of Gum (who is with qualities as well as beyond all qualities) and basic worship is worship of the feet of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਮੰਤ੍ਰ ਮੂਲ ਗੁਰੁ ਵਾਕ ਹੈ ਸਚੁ ਸਬਦੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਸੁਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Mantr Moolu Guru Vaak Hai Sachu Sabadu Satiguroo Sounaaay.
translation: Basis of the mantras is the word of the Guru and the true Guru recites the true word.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣੋਦਕੁ ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰ ਹੈ ਚਰਣ ਕਮਲ ਗੁਰੁ ਸਿਖ ਧੁਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Charanodaku Pavitr Hai Charan Kamal Guru Sikh Dhuaaay.
translation: The wash of the feet of Guru is sacred and the Sikhs wash the lotus feet (of the Guru).

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣਾਂਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਕਸਮਲ ਕਟੇ ਗੁਰੁ ਧੂਰੀ ਬੁਰੇ ਲੇਖ ਮਿਟਾੲੇ
transliteration: Charanaamrit Kasamal Katay Guru Dhooree Buray Laykh Mitaaay.
translation: Nectar of the feet of Guru cuts asunder all sins and the dust of the Guru's feet erases all evil writs.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਨਾਮੁ ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਿਦੈ ਸਮਾੲੇ
transliteration: Sati Naamu Karataa Purakhu Vaahiguroo Vichi Ridai Samaaay.
translation: By its grace the true named creator Lord, Vahiguru, comes to reside in the heart.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਤਿਲਕ ਮਿਟਾੲਿ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਤਿਲਕ ਨੀਸਾਣ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Baarah Tilak Mitaaikay Guramoukhi Tilak Neesaan Charhhaaay.
translation: Effacing the twelve marks of the yogis, the gurmukh puts on his forehead the mark of the grace of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਰਹੁਰਾਸੀ ਰਹੁਰਾਸਿ ੲੇਹੁ ੲਿਕੋ ਜਪੀਅੈ ਹੋਰੁ ਤਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Rahuraasee Rahuraasi Ayhu Iko Japeeai Horu Tajaaay.
translation: Out of all religious conducts, only one code of conduct is true that repudiat­ing all, one should go on remembering the one Lord alone.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਨ ਗੁਰ ਦਰਸਣ ਦੇਖਣਾ ਭ੍ਰਮਤਾ ਫਿਰੇ ਠੳੁਰ ਨਹੀ ਪਾੲੇ
transliteration: Binu Gur Darasanu Daykhanaa Bhramataa Dhiray Tdaurhi Naheen Paaay.
translation: Following any one other than the Guru, man goes on wandering without any shelter.

transliteration: Binu Guru Poorai Aaay Jaaay ?22?40?chaaleeha?
translation: De­void of the perfect Guru, jiv goes on suffering transmigration.

gurmukhi: ਸੀਂਚਤ ਸਲਿਲ ਬਹੁ ਬਰਨ ਬਨਾਸਪਤੀ ਚੰਦਨ ਸੁਬਾਸ ੲੇਕੈ ਚੰਦਨ ਬਖਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Seenchat Salil Bahu Baran Banaasapatee , Chandan Soubaas Aykai Chandan Bakhaaneeai ?
translation: By irrigation, several kinds of plants and vegetation can be grown but when they come in touch with sandalwood they are all called sandalwood (because they have the same fragrance).

gurmukhi: ਪਰਬਤ ਬਿਖੈ ੳੁਤਪਤ ਹੁੲਿ ਅਸਟ ਧਾਤ ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰਸਿ ੲੇਕੈ ਕੰਚਨ ਕੈ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Parabat Bikhai Outapat Hui Asat Dhaata , Paaras Parasi Aykai Kanchan Kai Jaaneeai ?
translation: Eight metals are obtained from mountain but when each one of them are touched by philosopher-stone become gold.

gurmukhi: ਨਿਸ ਅੰਧਕਾਰ ਤਾਰਾ ਮੰਡਲ ਚਮਤਕਾਰ ਦਿਨ ਦਿਨਕਰ ਜੋਤਿ ੲੇਕੈ ਪਰਵਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Nis Andhakaar Taaraa Mandal Chamatakaara , Din Dinakar Joti Aykai Paravaaneeai ?
translation: In the darkness of the night, many stars shine but during the day, the light of one Sun alone is considered authentic.

gurmukhi: ਲੋਗਨ ਮੈ ਲੋਗਾਚਾਰ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ੲੇਕੰਕਾਰ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ੳੁਨਮਨ ੳੁਨਮਾਨੀਅੈ ||੪੦||
transliteration: Logan Mai Logaachaar Gurmukhi Aykankaara , Sabad Surati Ounaman Ounamaaneeai ?40?
translation: Similarly a Sikh who lives life according to the advice of his Guru becomes divine in all respects, even when he is living life as a worldly person. Due to the lodging of the divine word in his mind, he is known to be living in heavenly state. (40)
